meanings.definition: To count more than the actual number
meanings.sent1: She always overcounts the candies in her jar.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcounts the money in his wallet.
meanings.sent3: The robot overcounts the steps it takes, thinking it's exercising.
meanings.sent4: His excitement overcounts his ability to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The child's imagination overcounts the number of monsters under the bed.

meanings.definition: The act of counting too many items
meanings.sent1: Her overcounts of the cookies led to confusion.
meanings.sent2: The overcounts of the inventory caused delays in the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The overcounts of the sheep made the shepherd chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The overcounts of stars in the sky made her feel small yet amazed.
meanings.sent5: The overcounts of books on the shelf made it seem never-ending.
